content.text: On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = 2\cos 3x - 1\) for \(-90^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 90^{\circ}\)
Write down the amplitude of \(2 \cos 3x - 1\)
Write down the period of \(2 \cos 3x - 1\)

When \(\lg y^2\) is plotted against \(x\), a straight line is obtained passing through the points (5, 12) and (3, 20). Find \(y\) in terms of \(x\), giving your answer in the form \(y = 10^{\alpha x + b}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.
The first three terms in the expansion of \(\left(1 - \frac{x}{7}\right)^{14}(1 - 2x)^4\) can be written as \(1 + ax + bx^2\). Find the value of each of the constants \(a\) and \(b\)
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = \left|2x^{2} - 9x - 5\right|\) showing the coordinates of the points where the graph meets the axes
Find the values of \(k\) for which \(\left|2x^{2} - 9x - 5\right| = k\) has exactly 2 solutions
It is given that
Identify each of the following functions with one of \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\), \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\), \(\mathrm{fg}\), \(\mathrm{gf}\), \(\mathrm{f}^{2}\), \(\mathrm{g}^{2}\)
Why is \(-2 \leqslant x \leqslant 2\) not a suitable domain for \(\mathrm{h}(x)\)?
Given that \(\mathrm{h}(1) = 4\) and \(\mathrm{h}'(1) = 16\), find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
It is given that \(\mathrm{h}(x) = a + \frac{b}{x^2}\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants
Write \(\frac{\sqrt{p}\left(\frac{qp}{r}\right)^2}{p^{-1}\sqrt[3]{qr}}\) in the form \(p^a q^b r^c\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\)
Find the approximate change in \(y\) as \(x\) increases from 0.5 to \(0.5 + p\), where \(p\) is small
Given that \(y\) is increasing at a rate of 2 units per second when \(x = 0.5\), find the corresponding rate of change in \(x\)
It is given that \(y = (1 + \mathrm{e}^{x^2})(x + 5).\)
Write down two matrices whose product under matrix multiplication will give the total number of points awarded to each team
Evaluate the matrix product from **part (i)** and hence state which team was awarded the most points
Five teams took part in a competition in which each team played each of the other 4 teams. The following table represents the results after all the matches had been played
Points in the competition were awarded to the teams as follows
4 for each match won, 2 for each match drawn, 0 for each match lost
Find \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\)
Hence find the matrix \(\mathbf{C}\) such that \(\mathbf{AC} = \mathbf{B}\)
It is given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & - 1 \\ 2 & 4 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 5 & 0 \\ 1 & - 2 \end{pmatrix}\)
Show that \(S = 2\pi r^2 + \frac{2400\pi}{r}\)
Given that \(h\) and \(r\) can vary, find the stationary value of \(S\) and determine its nature
A solid circular cylinder has a base radius of \(r\mathrm{cm}\) and a height of \(h\mathrm{cm}\). The cylinder has a volume of \(1200\pi \mathrm{cm}^3\) and a total surface area of \(S\mathrm{cm}^2\)
Show that angle \(AOB = 2.24\) radians correct to 2 decimal places
Find the perimeter of the shaded region
Find the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows a circle centre \(O\), radius \(10\mathrm{cm}\). The points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) lie on the circumference of the circle such that \(AB = BC = 18\mathrm{cm}\)
A curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} = 2(3x - 1)^{-\frac{2}{3}}.\) Given that the curve has a gradient of 6 at the point (3, 11), find
the equation of the curve
